uiFufvIRwOwfAwEexNVLog.text: You really can't spend more than a few days in this city without hearing about Pamela's.  I was told it had decent food at a good price, but was really over hyped.  The new location has apparently also improved the food.  Now don't get me wrong; this place is a through and through American as apple pie type breakfast joint.  I feel like calling it a greasy spoon is really doing it a disservice.   The pancakes are great, the eggs perfectly fluffy and the meat is neither too salty nor overcooked.  On multiple occasions  the food has been consistent, quick and plentiful.  The portions are in no way small.  They aren't huge but they are more than any normal human should eat in one sitting.    Do you want a great all-American breakfast at a great price that is in no way greasy?  Pamela's is your best bet.  Cash only!

BIjgWPdGM5EX1T8sEyvRLQ.text: I live half a block from this new Pamela's location....which means I lived about 1 block from the old location.  I never went to the old location - just too far away I guess - but now that they're a cozy 1/2 block down the street, I summoned the energy to pay them a visit.  Ha, no, I'm not that lazy.  Honestly it was the outdoor tables that sold me about this location - and the fact that it's summer.  I figured we'd be waiting for a table, and who wants to wait in the snow?  Actually, at 11 on a Sunday, four of us got a table within about 15 minutes, so that's not bad at all.  We got a patio table too, which was great for people watching.  I know this is blasphemous, but none of us wanted pancakes.  I know!  Everything I read in the reviews beforehand was a rave about the glorious hotcakes.  I'm sure they are delicious, I just truly cannot eat a whole plateful of sweet dessert-esque breakfast.  Maybe if I come again with my boyfriend, he will get the pancakes and I can try them.   Instead, I got the corned beef hash.  The savory dishes were all pretty heavy and a little greasy, but honestly pretty good.  I enjoyed the salty meat, the abundant potatoes, and the well-cooked eggs.  The wheat toast was hilariously DROWNED in butter...which was kind of delicious.  But it was funny in its excess.  This food is all about excess, mainly in calorie form.  I couldn't finish it, but I usually can't finish my food, so that's not unusual.  The price was right - about $6.95 for a very big breakfast.  Service is quick and inattentive - don't bother waiting for your server to refill your water glass, you will need to flag someone down.  But we lingered a bit over coffee and nobody hassled us or tried to make us leave, so that was nice.  I'd come back - it's right across the street - but I honestly find the menu limiting.  Basically, go if you want pancakes or omelets.  The breakfast options besides those are limited.  I'd enjoy a wider variety of savory breakfast options, but frankly the food is so cheap, I'm happy to have whatever they're offering.  It's filling and satisfying, and decadent in its high-cal glory.

p7d60DCrWEpvwDJZ8nEacQ.text: Ahhh, that was a tasty meal. My blood pressure's up a little bit from the corned beef hash, but it was exactly as hash should be: hot, crumbly, salty, and crispy. Admittedly, I did request it extra crusty, because most places don't take the time to let the crust develop in their frenzied rush to serve the crowd of folks waiting impatiently outside. How would it have been cooked if I hadn't requested it that way? Who knows. But props for entertaining my request and cooking it right. The eggs were over easy as ordered, the orange juice was ice cold, and the price was right.  A few constructive comments: Cash only sucks in this day and age, especially when I can't keep track of what I spend my money on unless it's captured on my credit card statement. To the hostess, if you choose to sit me down at a table that still has dirty dishes on it, make sure to have it wiped down. Sure it was mostly clean, but there was a tiny puddle of coffee from the previous diner--kinda gross. Also, it took a smidge longer than one might expect for the waitress to come around, but when I flagged her down she was more than happy to take my order.  Lastly, the overall wait for a table wasn't too bad: I would say maybe 15 minutes mid-morning on a beautiful Sunday in September. Isn't that primo brunching time? Although, with the Steelers playing at home, I'm guessing a large chunk of their usual crowd was probably tailgating...

YxCOoCfP6tzBAFVzm9HmvA.text: Took a couple out of town friends to the new Pamela's location on a Monday morning. Our server was cheerful and friendly, and refilled drinks as if he were reading your mind. Our food came out SUPER fast. I mean like LIGHTNING. Our friends were really impressed, which makes us look good. The new interior is adorable, still retaining the retro kitsch everyone loves. Probably the best experience I've had at any Pamela's so far!  My only peeve with Pamela's is their bacon. It's not that good. It's too thin and skimpy and tastes like that microwaveable, pre-cooked bacon you get at the grocery store. I wish they would upgrade to some nice thick pepper bacon or something.  STILL cash only.

4Eg7u4hrbJ-KOZOFIIpd9w.text: Yummy breakfast, huge portions, great price point.  I had an omelet (I like mine a bit underdone) and it was perfection. My BFF had the corned beef hash.  The service is exceptional, even when they are slammed. I can see why locals love this chain/place.

od5SDM86wyxF-wZkaq-NsA.text: Best brunch in the city. The hotcakes (plain, blueberry, or strawberry) are amazing. So are the breakfast potatoes and hash.  Anytime someone from out of town visits, we take them here and they love it.

Yi3Bg9ic-pnGXHyKCdyMVw.text: Although bigger than its previous location (now including outdoor seating) this new location seems to be lacking the pizzazz and charm that it had before. However, the food is still great greasy spoon breakfast grub; can't go wrong with their hotcakes and be sure to give their corned beef hash a try. Also don't forget cash as it's still cash only!

ktE5WyrfOvG7KdZWdFktvg.text: This is a mixed review.   We were pleased to see that the OG Pamela's had spread it's wings and moved to a bigger location. Since our fair President had visited Pamela's (and made her pancake recipe a White House staple- holla!) this modest chain has gained much more popularity it seems- even though there were always lines around the block to get in.  Pat and I elected to sit outside, even though it was rainy and humid. On the far wall there is a bunch of old Pamela's memorabilia, but the patio are was super cramped, and felt kind of generic. My rear end brushed against the table next to me and my eyes met the glare of a not so pleased diner (not that u can blame her- I was in workout gear and this was a post-workout brunch).   The service was prompt and friendly. I ordered the Spinich and Feta omelette, with a side of pancakes (oh course!) and it seemed that somewhere between the trek "upstreet" the size of the omelette had shrunk. The pancakes were as delish a ever though.  I don't know- I would come again but would elect to sit inside next time. The vibe seemed a lot more authentic in there, with much more elbow room.  Ps. Glaring girl, if you are reading this, sorry 'bout that.  Pss. Cute blonde waitress who thought I was a dude and kept calling me a "him", it's all good. I've been called worse. ;)

kXSExAAecESpHaShVJUGVA.text: A long time ago, I went to a Pamela's with some friends, and walked away upset because I didn't like the ala carte system; the best deals are with the set breakfasts, and you pay more getting exactly what you want.  I still don't like that, but it doesn't hold me back from giving this place five stars, mainly because it's that good.  If this is your first time to a Pamela's, by all means get the pancakes.  They don't make 'em like this anywhere else.  The lyonnaise potatoes are also really amazing.  Recently, all I ever order is the blueberry stuffed pancakes - again, I could nitpick, and say I wish the blueberries weren't as cold as they are, but again - those pancakes.  As far as this particular location goes, it's the newest, and much larger than the old location.  They give you carafes of coffee at your table, and the mugs themselves are no longer those chintzy little plastic things, but solid ceramic.  Things like that matter.

GfOTZxS-aZZmpS-P1ATVUQ.text: Looking for a greasy home style breakfast? Pamela's doesn't skip a beat. Even though they are famous for their hot cakes I personally am more of a fan of their omelettes. The potatoes shouldn't be ever skipped and the coffee is perfection. Make sure you bring cash because they don't accept major credit cards. But don't let that stop you!

Xbct74Qf82MLB8_pBLyKUQ.text: Awesome, yet crowded, and slightly overrated. I grew up in Pittsburgh and I could pretty much walk to their previous location (not too far down the street, on Forbes) and I oftentimes did, with my mom. Their strawberry hotcakes are more like crispy crepes with a slight dose of brown sugar, sour cream, and awesomely warm strawberry topping + whipped cream. Unffff. So good. Crispity yet soft. Salty, yet sweet. I am starting to drool just typing this. I want to go back, but alas, I am in St. Louis. Overrated because the place is always freaking packed so you expect a 5 star experience, when in reality, it's only a 4. (In my book at least.) The staff can be pushy sometimes. They were telling people to "go wait outside" in the freeze-ass cold. Yes, I get that they need room to move around, but it seems a little harsh to say that. Why not just turn on (MORE) heaters outside and/or enclose the area somehow? I dunno. Seemed a little cruel. Thankfully there's pretty rapid turnover and we only had to wait about 15 min for our party of 3. Ran into old friends there. Man, I miss home!!

KBecmzM0Cfo9U7ty_Hmyng.text: I have been to the Pamela's in Shadyside, and enjoyed my meal there. My visit to the Pamela's in Squirrel Hill was very disappointing, to say the least. I went with 2 friends, and everyone's meal was dripping in grease - now I expect this place to be a greasy spoon, but this was way too much. We all left feeling gross, and I will never go back to this one again. If it weren't for the extremely limited breakfast options in Squirrel Hill on the weekends, I would not have gone there in the first place.

3ZKRCiJ_JjVOL3mw2sF7yQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here to look for some good breakfast. Their food is tasty at first, but it takes just for one or two bites later until you realize that it's way too greasy and extremely salty! We had ordered multiple items since we were very hungry and we were completely disappointed when all of their food tasted exactly the same! A salty heart attack!

KQKcyNoELHB7nMRgqVLDQQ.text: Our all time favorite breakfast destination. Grandchildren come from NY for the pancakes that are out of this world!

RJcZplb8Sg5Quw4aiaxzjw.text: This location has a long line (that moves surprisingly fast ) for a reason.  Excellent pancakes and corned beef hash as well as kind and efficient service.   Really a perfect breakfast!!

slhz62wjMNHgMI6HopmCvg.text: I feel like this is the best one comparatively to all of the Pamela's locations. It is cash only which is the only drawback. The food is excellent and is always quick.

XAy2cJpNLMMsMM-IqZMmqQ.text: The hot cakes are very good. In the winter, they use frozen strawberry but they use fresh ones in summer. My favorite one is walnut banana hot cake. The service is very  fast because they always have a long line. The waiter service is ok. For 7 to 8 dollar per person breakfast, the price is good.

77HLSA-rTT-XI5RIqc7D2g.text: Excelllent!! They serve a big portion so be prepared!!

FXp-VMCZ6kqWPXUOs1nwSg.text: The food is good but the service is bad, they think they are doing us a favor by serving us. It's your job a$$hole!!!

MID7Y2QxUWWghA6_OpBo3Q.text: Love Pamela's! Obviously, not the place to go if you're trying to eat healthy, but their salty lyonnaise potatoes and buttery hotcakes are amazing for a Saturday brunch.

fy0e-fFDFFkJ1Ce4Fxd1uA.text: Nah. I just don't get it... I just don't get it. Pamela serves  really basic breakfast food - sorry. I'm always amazed by the lines waiting to be seated. I've tried Pamela's numerous times and  consistently disappointed. The establishment never seems really clean and  feel the same about the food - greasy omelets/potatoes drench in sauce. etc. The service is usually decent which is why I'm giving it two stars.  If your in a crunch -hey it can work. Brunch and breakfast can sometimes be challenging in the Burgh...and Pamela's it's a no go...

GbNU7E3zhPJM3Glabmmamw.text: Fantastic breakfast spread with locations throughout pittsburgh. Expect a wait but its well worth it!

0KvCunnuq_KHLJN4YzwcJw.text: CASH ONLY!?! Ridiculous. Pretty sure the over priced food could off set the cost of accepting debit/credit.

g4iZZkPSeWp2JKFjDmPnEA.text: AMAZING!! We almost licked our plates. We were visiting Pittsburgh and this was the highlight of our trip. I had the famous pancakes, with strawberry and sour cream filling, and they definitely earned their reputation. I read that Obama had these flown to the White House for him and I would believe it.

RoV1CdAGfleEvPl3r1XGCw.text: Wow the pancakes. So good that I went back for more the next day.   I've been to the Shadyside location many times, but this was my first time at this location. I think the breakfast is priced really well for what it is. The staff is very adept at managing the crowds.   Cash only. Kind of annoying.

vEKd5e6kEGSZ_amHPFqhog.text: As a breakfast food person, enjoyed the casual dining with homemade feel of all the food. Got to try their crepe like pancakes with syrup or go for the specialties with fruit. Love the Monday After Breakfast Special - no nonsense eggs your way, meat and pancakes. The hash dishes are yummy. The servers are easy going and let's you be.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waffles also a good choice
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The morning after breakfast special

YRIUC7tVcrpzTFaWgGwSuA.text: The atmosphere is all American diner with all the classics  but done with some cool variations.  We tried the two of the hashes--corned beef and chorizo.  The corned beef was good but nothing outstanding.  The chorizo was chock full of sausage and delicious--spicy good!  We also tried the California French toast and highly recommend it.  Prepared excellently, sweet and gooey but not overly sweet!  From a food perspective, I would recommend this place in a heartbeat.  Where it fell short for us was the service.  We had two different waitresses for order and food delivery.  The ordering waitress was perfunctory and spared no pleasantries to the point that it exuded rudeness.  The waitress that delivered our food was very pleasant but we only saw her for a couple seconds during delivery.  We ate our food, finished and never saw a waitress again.  No coffee refill beyond the initial pour,  no check in to make sure everything was all right and had to go to the register to ask for our check.  My tip will reflect this service.  It's too bad because the food is worth it but the service is absolutely sub par!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast menu

6d9sq9owBCwXUG1dEBjZbw.text: Yeah, there's a reason the hotcakes are so popular.   They're really, really good. They're not as thick as traditional pancakes and the edges are thin and crisp, like lacy crepes. I ordered mine with a breakfast (as I failed to eat dinner the night before - I was on a plane, and then I was too tired), with strawberry topping, and it was SO DELICIOUS. If I had spent a few more days, I'd probably go again, but I'm sure this would be on my list for a return trip.   The rest of the breakfast was normal diner fare. I have no complaints, but it wasn't particularly memorable. The sausage was greasy but good. The coffee was subpar, though.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry hotcake! Mmm.

sQoM_0QRHebuFklnAHJ14Q.text: Was here for breakfast - epitome of diner food breakfast for sure.  Protip: Hotcakes are not pancakes.  This place serves hotcakes, meaning they are greasily cooked platters of batter and will taste as much.  It might not be everyone's favorite, or even good, but it does serve a purpose.  I probably could only eat them once a year - or every two years - but they have an appeal.  (To be fair, I can only really eat one pancake or hotcake, they just automatically fill me up).  Coffee is served in carafes here - excellent.  This place gets 3 stars because it's a cool hang and place to eat with friends, but there's nothing extraordinary about it or that draws you back when there's so much more around that's shiny and attractive.

yzAym048Nbz_31aqpYgm4w.text: The pancakes hit the spot!  One order can feed two.   The potatoes are a must.  We waited until it was nearly noon and had no problem finding a table, but I can see how the weekends can get crazy.  Cash-only.

CHNFagP556RkDUCEzpF7GA.text: Well I was fortunate enough to have the presidential pancakes. No there actuly called Pamela's famous crepe-style hotcakes.  President Obama was right. They are worth the trip. I would say this is a place for regular visits.

vkyXvAVzaKKrsrs7yzlODw.text: Absolutely delicious! Was my first time having corned beef hash and now I'm scared to get it anywhere else because I don't want it to be ruined for me. I also got the California French Toast topped with bananas and walnuts. My girlfriend got the California French Toast topped with chocolate chips and walnuts. We both give this place 10 out of 5 stars. Was only in town for the weekend competing in a fitness competition but anytime I'm in Pittsburgh, there's no doubt I'll be visiting this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Don&#39;t mind the creepy face. I was hungry! California French Toast with Banana and Walnuts (left), Corned Beef Hash (right)
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. California French Toast with Bananas and Walnuts. #nomnomnom!

5NpzNk9-PL_a6m3OLr4SbA.text: Best pancakes/hot cakes I've ever had.  I'm not in the pancake fan club but these were amazing. Thin and the perfect mixture of crispy/chewy. The stuffed cakes are actually rolled up with whatever you choose.  We will definitely be back next time we're in Pittsburgh!

Xv2s5-ZFEBVvRiXBWtLKDA.text: I went here after a Saturday morning of hauling debris to clear space for an outdoor classroom wanting one thing - something to satisfy a serious hunger.  Fortunately, that's what Pamela's is good at.  We also got there at a pretty good time, around 1:30, so our group didn't even have to wait for a table.  I got the stuffed banana and chocolate chip hotcakes.  They were on point.  This was also the only time that I actually was able to eat the entire things.  The portions are typically very large, so unless you spent your morning doing physical labor you probably won't be able to finish everything (without regretting it).  This is a solid brunch place. I've taken visitors from out of town to Pamela's a couple times and it's a staple PIttsburgh experience that I'd be glad to repeat more often.

yv_zv4a7NeJp8j5DCoJfuA.text: On our way out of town, we stopped by Pamela's to fuel up for the road.  The food here is extra greasy, but also extra delicious.  They can get a little crowded later in the morning, but when we visited around 9 on a Saturday morning there was plenty of seating available.  I think most of Pamela's dishes are fairly good, but there are two in particular that I would recommend.  On this particular visit I got to eat some of both - the Blueberry Hotcakes and the Corned Beef Hash.  Actually, any kind of specialty hotcakes are great.  Pamela's hotcakes are kind of crepe-like - thin and buttery, and extra delicious with any (and all) kinds of toppings.  The corned beef hash is tasty, and my favorite out of the savory dishes.  Overall, good food, low prices, and decent portions.  Great for breakfast or brunch!

5M74oBN8tR-xD7vlHWWwCw.text: Stopped by this morning for breakfast before heading for home after CMU's Ceilidh weekend.  Found the line for a table was rather long but moved fairly fast - it is always worth the wait for the great fare!  Today, I enjoyed the Chorizo Hash - spicy and very flavorful with a good size portion.  Service moved at a good pace from placing our order, to getting our food right through paying...  It looks like we will be making this a regular breakfast spot while visiting CMU!  Thanks for yet another GREAT meal.

XP6UWkqAJx_t9619gCblUg.text: I'm not the only one who thinks Pittsburgh's obsession with Pamela's is strange.   It's an extremely limited diner plus crepes. Please stop calling them "hotcakes".  They are not hotcakes, they are large delicious crepes. It harkens back to a time when people wouldn't eat that fancy shit. So, "hotcakes". Embaressing.   Other than that it's a decent diner.  Cash only and it's basically exclusively breakfast. I think they close at one or two. The menu, after the crepes, is an extremely limited selection of breakfast norms and some salads and some wraps for some reason.   There is a wait most weekends. The service is service. Apperently servers don't have sections and split tips? It's crowded and noisy even on weekdays. I'll call the ambiance "Pittsburgh Excited". Which is fine. But it's not nearly as good as "I Could Read A Paper".   I don't have anything against Pamela's, really. Its the mystic I have a problem with, it's a three star (or maybe four star becuase delicious crepes) diner with a five star reputation.    I don't think Pittsburghers really know what a diner should be like. Eat and Park, Pamela's and Ritters have ruined your concept of a diner. Eat and Park is a place for crazy people with overweight children and Ritter's, much like AA, is a an event for drunks except without the alcohol (thumbs down), so Pamela's with their hotcrepes gets all the praise.   Crepecakes are delicious, but please, stop treating it like the prize of pittsburgh, it's embarrassing.

diuaGqNBKiA0hjADcUe1eg.text: There are a few Pamela's in the Pittsburgh area. This one happens to be in the heart of squirrel hill. If you didn't know Pamela's is Barack Obama's favorite restaurant in the city of Pittsburgh (however, he typically frequents the one in the strip). Pamela's is open for breakfast, brunch, and lunch. They are famous for their crepe style hotcakes and Lyonnaise potatoes. Their hotcakes are very thin and usually packed with goodies inside. My personal favorite is the banana chocolate chip ones. The Lyonnaise potatoes are the most scrumptious potatoes in the world. They are in between a home fry and hash style of potato with onions and lots of butter. I simply cannot go to Pamela's without ordering a side of them. The squirrel hill location has bottomless coffee for $2, which I also always enjoy. They can range between in expensive to moderate in price, depending on what you order. I would say that most people can find something delicious and filling within their budget here.   The only downside to this place is they are very popular, which means you are likely to wait for a seat. That being said, they are so worth the wait!

nocSHFm8ScQzYsQnArIxFw.text: We came for Sunday brunch and my first impression was that the place is very dirty. There was random debris all over the floor and our table was sticky. Also- they only serve breakfast food on Sunday, yet they allow regulars to get lunch if they want if. They also rushed us in and out. I thought the pancakes were a little greasy.   I really wasn't into this place and I don't get the hype. I won't be back.

DTVb9xVmLnntcvZjFJbzVA.text: I had a cheese omelette here and it was super delicious. The complimentary  fries and the garlic bread were also good. Would surely visit this place when I go back to Pittsburg again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

h7TvjnlIHfxuKxXOjWzRTA.text: Some friends and I took a day trip to Pittsburgh from Cleveland, and our first stop was to get some brunch at Pamela's. It was crowded and there was a long line, but that's how you know you're in the right place.  Now it has been a while, so I can't quite recall the food anymore, but I do know that it was delicious, filling, and very reasonably priced. I do remember that the hotcakes are recommended though!  The reason that this experience really stood out to me, was the attention they placed on their service. Now we had a decent group of people, and one person got her order before everyone else did. There really wasn't that significant of a wait in-between though, so imagine our surprise when the server actually apologized for the wait, and gave our entire table 50% off our meal.  The experience here was enough to make our entire trip worth it!

bplRIZ_ygN2ZtjmsH3O3Ig.text: A late Sunday morning went well here.  The portions were generous, especially considering the prices.  The wait was a bit long, and the place was packed, but the wait wasn't unreasonable.  The food did take a bit longer than expected to arrive, but was fresh and hot when it did come.  The cofee wasn't bad, a tad on the weak side, as most diner coffee is.  We left the table fully satisfied.

OZjYjVyh4tl8dyqJYQBVdQ.text: Two breakfasts in two days - I do love me some Pamela's.  This location is especially awesome because both days, I was able to walk right in and sit down (no standing out on the sidewalk for an hour like at the Strip location).  I'm not saying you can do that all the time - there was a line when we left - but we did an early-ish weekend breakfast and didn't have to wait.    As always, the food is consistently good, the service is fast, and the portions are huge.  CASH only, which gets me sometimes, but it's a small thing for an otherwise excellent breakfast spot.

KasluXgfMo3Ihu6JYmSgzA.text: Pros: Food was very tasty  Cons: Service was awful.  This was my first time visiting some friends in Pittsburgh.  They told my girlfriend and I Pamela's was the best breakfast in town.  We walked in and were told to sit anywhere. There were some open tables that were cleared, but none of them were wiped down, so we sat down at the cleanest booth.  Our table had crumbs on it and was stick, but what ever, we didn't mind.   Our server greeted us fairly quickly. She was very nice.  We ordered our food and got it very quickly.  Another server gave us our check with our food and walked away before we had a chance to ask for silverware.  We figured she'd be back shortly to check on us... After about 10 minutes my girlfriend went to ask another server for silverware.  I cut into my omelette to find it was broccoli and cheese, not bacon and cheese as I had ordered.  The writing on the check was chicken scratch, so no surprise there. Again, I waited and waited and at my potatoes (delicious!) and toast, had another few cups of coffee.  Our server never checked on us again, but we cut see her across the room just standing.   I asked the cashier to ask the kitchen to remake my omelette when I went up to pay.  I had to wait a while for the recook, but I got it to go, and it was good the next day.  My girlfriend is a server, so I'm very sympathetic to my servers and usually tip at least 25%.  This is one of two times I didn't leave any tip.

afrVWIq1V7-Sls_BsGz_mQ.text: We arrived on a Sunday morning and it was pretty busy. We gave our name and waited. It didn't take too long to be seated. Our waitress came quickly and was nice. The place it's self has an old 50's to 60'd diner feel. Even though they were cleaning tables it didn't feel clean even though it looked ok.  Your crammed in pretty tight and they have no concern about smashing a highchair against your table for the table sitting next you. The food came quickly and at 1st tasted delicious... about half way through the grease/butter/oil from the potatoes caches up to you and since it tates good you continue untill all the greese/butter/oil soaked food is gone and you realize as your stomach begins to remind you, eating it wasn't a good idea.    It also seems a bit pricy compared to other similar places.   They also share the space with another restaurant called NU Jewish cafe (something like that) when they really should occupy the entire space. And as I found out don't dare stand any place around the other restaurant unless that is  where you plan on going or you will receive a tongue lashing.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cash onlu
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Very, very tasty!  If you don&#39;t mind a busy place, and cash only

G4YzwLAq_4gG2zS3RCnvNw.text: They wouldn't cook burgers to order -- the only option was REALLY well done. Also, it was a hassle to split the check because the waitress didn't total it up, so we had to all gather around the cash register after the meal and sort it out after the cashier rung it up. The rest of the food was decent breakfast fare and the waitress was great, but that didn't make up for a broken system and a long wait standing out on the sidewalk.

gur7AmnFnjJgE26XdlV5ug.text: This is my first time visiting this location, and I already love this place!! I took a risk stopping by before an appointment, knowing i could end up being late, but the service was so fast it was no problem at all. (For reference though, the waitress did mention it was less busy than usual for a weekday morning because of the rainy weather.) My waitress was Jaime, and Liz cashed me out, and they were both super kind and attentive! My food was ready what felt like instantly, and it was great standard diner fare. I had the veggie omelette and it was great! Highly recommended if you're looking for a quick but sit-down breakfast in Squirrel Hill. Also, other reviews have mentioned this too, but they are in fact cash-only.

4zcoRamDA-O2FjpZsvMRsw.text: No problem with the food but the staff could be a little more welcoming .  Don't tell anyone I ate there because I've been eating at Ritters diner for 50 years , and they would be pissed .

xtGfuCBuGsxDnP7Lwl5bhQ.text: I am a fan but not sure I would return. Bacon was wafer thin, near paper thickness. Zero flavor too. Eggs real good with good color yellow yokes. I had a plain waffle. Was best I've had anywhere by far. Pancakes same. I really liked the thin and near crispy edges. I rated less than 5 stars only because of lesser bacon. Very good service. Yes, I would return just because I really like the waffle and pancakes.

aEkgcTauuNEqDyk9Zz-KLA.text: If you are here on weekends, there is definitely going to be a wait time. I tried almost all varieties of breakfast here. My favorites are strawberry hotcake, lyonnaise potatoes and french toast. If I have friends visiting Pittsburgh, this is a to go place on the list for breakfast or brunch. There is no instance when they didnot like the place.

_JMBsulivOh9Slw_xFCrVw.text: I wanted to love this place because I've heard so many good things about it but unfortunately I did not. Went on a week day when it wasn't too busy. Ordered coffee and water. Water was served in a plastic cup that had a crack in it. It wasn't leaking but inside the crack was dark dirty gross stuff. I didn't notice until halfway through. That cup should really be thrown away! I've worked in restaurants so I know that didn't get like that after just one use....  Please throw that cup away! I ordered the tex- Mex omlette with potatoes and wheat toast. Potatoes were AWESOME! Unfortunately both my omlet and toast were cold. The insides of my omlet were not even warm. Cheese was no where near  melted and meat was almost luke warm. The toast couldn't even melt the "butter". I can't say for sure but I'm 99 percent sure it wasn't even real butter which is a bummer. Only got offered a refill on my coffee right before I was ready to leave. I'll give it one more try since there are off days in businesses too. Hopefully next time it will be much better!

2hekJ7qCxoi10YH8wn_3XQ.text: If you live in Pittsburgh, you have to come here for  breakfast/brunch. Amazing hotcakes. They're more like a cross between a crepe and a pancake, but so buttery and delicious. They do get sickening after a while though. I also recommend their Lyonnaise potatoes. Crispy, oniony, salty, and delicious. I've also tried their cinnamon raisin bread. Very sweet and full of fat raisins.  For lunch I've tried their fish sandwich. The fish is huge and they give you a lot of fries, but it is an average fish sandwich.   Come really early in the morning, otherwise line is always long, especially at the Shadyside location. Overall, large portions, cheap price, not good for diet.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dZDBUBjF7wB0AkFraNa5Zw.text: If your dish does not come with the potatoes, get a side of them! A staple of this restraunt.   Lidia's is characteristic for its interesting takes on typical breakfast dishes- like pancake crepes!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Egg salsa sandwich on rye bread, side of potatoes

hOSeE1IE1gjAz3hCkISxcw.text: Good Lord, so much good food.  Lately I have been eating everything, devouring every morsel and leaving nothing for the other patrons. I am on a winning streak here.  Most portions @ this always crowded diner can be split 2 or 3 ways.  Prices are relatively low. This is diner food ... so expect DINER food, not 5-star gourmet fairtrade stuff. They call it a diner and run it like one. Cash only folks. Remember cash? Expect a wait. A wait means lots of people are waiting for GOOD food ... eh? This is a great place to kill a hangover with a pot of coffee.  Stop by, you'll be pleased.

VPTbZ-ta19BEMbLRun0JGA.text: Wonderful crepe pancakes and great service!!my waiter was very attentive ...food was out in less than ten minutes I was amazed  Everything was perfect...I will go back and take my family next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crepe strawberry pancakes and cheesy eggs ...too much for one person!!deliciousness

JooTcXCk1Je7mRB3LqYXLA.text: When you're in Pittsburgh you have to go to Pamela's at least once. This is probably the least busy of the several locations so I recommend this one over any of the others. It's street parking but luckily on a Sunday it's easier to find.  The crepes are fantastic (banana walnut yup) and I always go for the corned beef hash. Their other egg dishes (especially the one with chorizo) is very tasty.   Just remember - Cash only.

78VDKgf1F6c3CK65268VJQ.text: It's a breakfast institution in the 4-1-2 for a reason, folks. Of course their famous crepe hot cakes are the sweet order, but show the savory side of your soul some love, too. The omelettes are generous and the Lyonnaise potatoes are THE best...they don't get any better than this. The pot o' joe on the table will remind you to look up from your food every now and again. Inhale. Exhale. Dive back in!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A mammoth omelette + signature Lyonnaise potatoes + toast

Ff2JE2E7dhvztQDk1g5uRA.text: Very cute, it took awhile to serve us though (and it wasn't busy). Reasonable prices. The food was amazing and the vibe was very chill but not as warm as the typical diner.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The french toast is a must, but the other stuff isn&#39;t half bad either.

wXp-VgmAgQsypS3_08KoRw.text: Best Breakfast in Pittsburgh. There is a reason why this place is always so crowded. If you don't like Pamela's breakfast, you might not be able to feel happiness.

kaRRhkmCo2lfXeo9Rt9G4g.text: My experience was 2 stars but I give 3 out of praise for what they do so right (pancakes and potatoes) So my mistake was to skip the pancakes and order the omelet. What kind of cheese project liquefies and runs like that? I got omelet because I don't like wet eggs. ew. Potatoes were great. It's nice to know they are they same at each location.  Sadly the service is the same at each location.  One person takes order, one delivers it. That's it. You practically have to set up flares again to get someone's attention if you need anything. No followup.  Only taking cash is still annoying but not tallying the check so it is hard to figure out what you need, calculating a tip etc is more math than I like to do in the morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheese and veggie omelet. Cheese was more like water running out and making eggs wet. Gross!

abfIi8RlW0-5v5pWaAt4IA.text: Not really any good healthy items on their breakfast menu. Just crepes (no regular or buckwheat pancakes). Somewhat rough service (not horrible, just not great). The windowed area is cold in the colder months. Toast was not toasted.

ZPo2d7OKbECfmr2uIPGypg.text: How could you be closed on Dec 26th! How!!?? Why would you do this to us! We had to settle for eat n park.... You're Still the best though! Best breakfast in the burgh.

iOVSvz9oV5iN7X0mhFl6Bg.text: Pamela's is just the best. The staff is really what makes this place great and keeps me coming back (far too many) weekends. They are always attentive and once when they messed up my order they offered it to me on the house. Gale's favorite eggs is my favorite next to their waffles. The crepes are fine but much too sweet for me. Also their bacon is thin, but whatever.

FtrWoRnlMpBC5MELx9MBWA.text: It was empty but service was still lousy. I asked the waitress for cheese to go with my fries and she brought back 2 slices of American cheese. What am I supposed to do with that?

onsbsqV-gBlJApfNA1NyVw.text: Love this place! Great to go to when you need some quick delicious breakfast. Only downside is the line you'll have to wait in to get in on weekends.

ZGh0yr5OLi7EbM5XSkaQYg.text: When I'm in Pittsburgh, I'm eating breakfast at Pamela's. The burnt ends of the crepe-style hotcakes are one of my favorite tastes of any food, ever. It is much easier to snag a table here during their busy weekend brunch hours if you're a party of two. If you come in a larger group, be prepared for a longer wait. The wait is worth it though. When it comes to breakfast, this is as good as it gets.

ZtnLQAT3jvYqj-HKcwp8kQ.text: Overrated. The food is not worth the dining experience and the staff is less than friendly or accommodating. I'll never attempt to eat here again.

ChjtZsbpW88FWNJvuMQYSA.text: Would you serve a table food that was sitting out for 20 mins at a different table because you got the order wrong? Yeah. Gross.  My friend ordered pancakes and I ordered corned beef hash. They were delivered to the wrong table. I see the waitress take the pancakes from the table (which was within earshot since i heard the convo about the mistake) go behind the counter then serve the same plate to our table. obviously the pancakes were cold and unappetizing but the waitress didn't seem to care. We let the front counter know and they made a new order, but the fact that they would do that in the first place is just wrong. My food on the other hand was feshly made but arrived later.   I was so grossed out by the pancakes that I cannot even comment on the food. My appetite was ruined.

3AzK2tYplt1xp38LWes2AA.text: Always worth the wait!  The hot cakes might kill you if you're already on the verge of blocking an artery, but they're worth it!  The potatoes are also some of the best I've ever ordered anywhere.  To top it all off, the wait staff is always on its game.   If you're not willing to wait, you can usually walk right in after 1:00 or so.

BBWywCfdnPXP8mgOLz0NSQ.text: Apparently Pamela's is a most try for their pancakes, but I wasn't impressed.  It tasted like a thin, greasy, fried crepe.  I prefer my pancakes light, fluffy, and melting in my mouth.  Seeing as how the pancakes are the main attraction, I'm not in a hurry to go back.  The service was average to slow, due to the large crowds, and the decor & atmosphere is just ok.

0ENuUBqdsXnvkoh83prJMQ.text: PANCAKES!  YUM!  I only have three issues with Pamela's.  The wait times, the small tables, and the fact that they don't take credit cards.  Otherwise, YUM!  They have the best pancakes in Pittsburgh and, quite possibly, the country.

4aIoNmEpiKICwh17nOsJNw.text: I still don't get the local attraction of Pamela's.  It's the place to be seen on weekend mornings, but the food is mediocre at best.  Combine it with bad service, and you get two stars.  I've been 3-4 times now, and the waitresses have, on all visits, forgotten something, brought food out at weird intervals, or otherwise demonstrated a lack of any sort of focus on good, consistent service from the owners and/or managers.    Do yourself a favor and hit a better brunch place for better food or just hit the Eat'n Park down the street for solid brunch food with better service.    I really want to follow my standard rule and take another star off for not taking credit cards, too, but I'll be nice and keep them at two.  Pamela's is by no means a tiny mom and pop place, so it's time for them to realize that it's not 1985 anymore.  (Of course, that would make it harder to hide revenue, too.)

lOnzhLFehmR5G7Uekh8s8Q.text: I don't know why Pamela's is popular.  Hangover food? Yes. Filling? Yes. Cheap? Yes. Impressive/good quality? Noooo.  Orange juice is from concentrate. Maple syrup is corn syrup. Whipped cream is not homemade. Basically, you're getting cheap food made with cheap ingredients. That's FINE if you're in the mood for a quick grease fix. Pamela's will satisfy you. It's tasty enough for what it is, but I would never rave about it or say it was anything special. I feel very much let down because I expected something better based on their reputation as a Pittsburgh favorite. I'm actually kind of mad about it. I need to calm down! Also, the servers have been unfriendly on several occasions.  Still looking for a Pittsburgh breakfast gem...

-OKX8SnhMu7AHCheZ9iOVQ.text: Never again. First I tried to get an employee to wipe a table so I could sit down but she rudely walked past me and screamed "seat yourself". Yes, I'm aware, but I would prefer to sit at a clean table.   After my order my taken my bill that was given to me and I never saw my server again. I sat with an empty drink for 20 minuets before eventually going to the register to ask for a refill.  By this point my sandwich was cold and stale and not every enjoyable. I was going to make a complaint to a manager constructively so that the problem could be fixed, but I do not believe any management was present.   I generally do like Pamela's and the food is always good but the poor service and complete lack of management has pushed me to my breaking point. I will no longer spend my money in Pamela's Squirrel Hill location.

zV2a0fQZ-pfdwhdWJRIbWA.text: This place is cool.  I dig the crepe pancakes.  The malted waffle was good too.  Tried a ham and egg club sando with onion rings and the pile of rings was real respectable.  Good eats and they kept the drink refills coming.  They are cash only which was a slight inconvenience.   Being from out of town, the closest ATM hit me for $3 service and I am sure my bank will do the same on the other end.

sd8oslbnOgBYVra2AqgLtw.text: Wonderful!   Clean place, wonderful and cheerful staff, and the food was delicious!   Don't mess around - get the pancakes they are famous for - you won't regret it!

BpiItNnEbH_wyDqc_OgUaw.text: What makes a fabulous all-day breakfast joint even better? When they move to a larger space that's lighter and brighter and even has a small outdoor patio, that's what! You can't miss with anything on the menu at Pamela's. A must is the Lyonnaise potatoes with any meal . . . so scrumptious!   I love the fact that they give you a nice-sized carafe of coffee so you don't have to wait for refills, and it's pretty good coffee to boot!  If I lived in the Burgh, there is no doubt this would be on my regular rotation for weekend breakfast . . . maybe even a couple of days during the week, too!

usFQGvjP79UQUbEZ3SWVSg.text: It doesn't look like much, but Pamela's is a great breakfast place and almost a Pittsburgh institution at this point.  My wife got the chocolate banana pancake and I just got english muffins and eggs and both were perfect!  We went at about 8 AM and were seated immediately.

fqdIPEof3wTe85C-DzjcZQ.text: Delicious, filling breakfast place. Quite crowded in the weekend mornings. Service is okay but sometimes plates and glasses are a little dirty.

piJQphZefXdk3iB49rsv1g.text: The pancakes are apparently the big thing here. Literally and figuratively. They are pretty tasty, but honestly it's pretty hard to have bad pancakes. Otherwise, the other foods are okay -- just typical breakfast/brunch foods. Maybe I'm just not a breakfast person.

rKnIs-4ImRoGm5-y_KGm6A.text: Here's my regular order: Two eggs scrambled. Home fries Sausage White toast Juice Sometimes I will had the ginormous pancakes. It's a lot of food and I mean a lot. My daughter and I will share this feast and still end up going home with extras. After this meal is consumed it takes a lot of energy to get up from the booth and walk.

s3l9CHJeFM0KMLuvI7OgvQ.text: Really rude employee, this place used to be my favorite diner place until July 5th around 12:30 noon... I went there with my wife and the senior waitress was really rude to us. We left in anger.

vjdkYOZ1BV2jwAykeMnz6Q.text: Great place for brunch, but it can get busy fast! They have really good hash and speciality pancakes, which is like a crepe like pancake. My favorite hash dishes are the pittsburgh hash which has kielbasa sausage and sauerkraut and the corned beef hash. You get a good sized portion and comes with toast. I was a bit sad one of my eggs came already popped and spilling yolk but it wasn't a big deal. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pittsburgh hash
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corned beef hash

8zLheMBJlnPN_tfpQiuTJw.text: This was my favorite place to get good breakfast food, but I haven't been able to go for quite a while. I guess in that time they changed a few things. I got a ham and cheese omelet with spinach which was runny and the spinach tasted frozen. So not the best, but definitely not the worst.

seclUDMrKGF-pHxLJ4SODA.text: Had a hankering for breakfast this morning while out with the Little Man...cause, why cook at home? Decided to try Pamela's in Squirrel Hill. 1st time here, and the reputation preceeding this joint is well deserved. Not a flaw, from the service, to the food, and the atmosphere...why haven't I been here before? The kiddo loved his eggs, bacon and hash browns. The pancakes that came with my food rivals the quality at Massarts...quite the standard to meet. The waitress was friendly and prompt...checked on us and refilled when needed. Very reasonably priced!  Terrific place! I''m definately gonna Schwarzenegger this place...I'll be back!

tYqYTg-0QPWe3nRsmdtwbQ.text: I don't know what it is, but Pamela's (both here and on Walnut St.) have really seriously gone downhill.  On multiple occasions, at both locations, I've gotten the same utterly mediocre, greasy, uncooked food, so it's not a single day's quirk.  Bacon with grease literally pooled in its nooks and just pouring off it, French toast dripping in bright yellow wet egg that had to be sent back at least once, and upon occasion twice, to get it even lightly cooked, etc.  Totally and completely disgusting.  And then the topper - the other day when I was at this location, I opted for various reasons to leave my power wheelchair at my table when I went to the restroom (in large part because it was too crowded to move it safely through the dining room and jockey it out of the dining room and into and out of the ladies' room) - and one of the waitresses took it upon herself to decide I needed it badly enough to push it back to me entirely without my permission.   And after my telling her *straight out* to *leave it alone* at my table when she said she wanted to get it and bring it to me.  So, she got it anyways, obviously, and managed to get it back to the restroom, where it ended up blocking *everyone* from getting into and out of the room - including me - and I was tripping all over it just to get my hands washed and get back into it.   I had put the footrest up to eat so I could get close enough to the table, and now I couldn't get it down because the restroom door was blocking it, which made it hard for me to get into it and operate it because I had to hold my legs up, etc., and more.  It was a total and utterly unnecessary problem.  While I was still in the stall, I could hear her crashing it into the door and walls repeatedly until I was *finally* able to get her to just stop and leave it the hell alone.  Before I was able to leave my own stall, I heard other women leaving the room without washing at all - and that means they also had their disgusting, unwashed hands all over my chair right after using the bathroom, because it wasn't physically possible to get past it without literally climbing on top of it, requiring hands on.    Now pushing a power wheelchair when you are not familiar with how to operate it is no mean feat.  It's dangerous as fuck to everyone around, and hazardous to the chair itself. How she managed to not slam into and run over other customers I have no idea, because it definitely takes practice to learn how to operate one and not crash it into other people or things - but she did screw up the chair itself by crashing it into doors and walls.    Pamela's did comp me my breakfast because of the hassle.  =============  While I'm at it, because accessibility is an important issue both to me and many other diners and shoppers, I usually say something in my reviews about what one will find in a place.    Here, their "accessible" restroom stall isn't actually fully accessible at all - because they have a baby changing table in there, which blocks the ability to get a wheelchair into the stall at all, let alone turned around to get back out.  It's freestanding, fortunately, so I suppose they would be willing to remove it temporarily upon request.  I have not tried that.  Knowing about that changing table is part of why I left the chair at my table in the first place, because I already *knew* it was going to be too difficult to cope with the damn inaccessible restroom.  It's a *dirty*-looking baby changing table, to boot - with the huge toilet paper lying right on the dirty bed surface.    ++++++++++++++++  That said, when I first came in, they were *super* helpful getting me settled at a table I was going to be comfortable at, back in a corner, even thought it meant them moving some tables and chairs around for me.  I can't fault them at all in that department, or with their food service.

TKywxo12PnGuZmNb9ZnveQ.text: I'd heard lots about this place. Went on a date here. As someone who loves breakfast food, I was not disappointed. Got myself cheesy scrambled eggs and their crepe style pancakes. Portions are hardy, delicious, and I couldn't finish it all, even though I tried my darndest. The prices are great given the portion sizes.  If you are a lover of all things breakfast, you must come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So much food. The famous pancakes on the left, cheesy eggs and sausage on the right. All amazing.

VbQXL5iCbOxHyx7hw2nzZg.text: If you think it is hard to find items like pancakes, scrambled eggs or bacon in Pittsburgh without having to wait in line, you'll love this place.  Enjoyed the corned beef hash during my last visit.

oUdo_MNscwnTPWejI6kx2A.text: Eaten here twice and had to return food twice.  First there was a piece of metal from a cleaning utensil in my eggs then there was a piece of plastic in my omelette.  Customer service was poor - I had to pay for both meals!   The only thing worth eating here are the crepe-style pancakes, otherwise it's typical poor quality diner food at a premium price.

Lnu7rG0vOKFHDYkxUvMGrA.text: Phenomenal very time I go!!! Service was a bit slow but my food came quick and was hot.

hRD0scCuyayJZjzfDvob-A.text: The food here was delightful! I ordered the pancakes and chorizo hash and it surpassed my expectations. Very unique twist on breakfast.

m_2JRYK2iGuNMkaOe2nV9Q.text: A 15-20 wait for Sunday brunch--not bad for a Pamela's location.  Service was quick once we were seated and the food even quicker.  We were eating 5 minutes after ordering.  I was super thankful for an EGG WHITE VEGGIE OMELET that actually wasn't greasy, YAY.  This is sadly never a given anywhere.  The omelet comes unseasoned, but with salt, pepper, and hot sauce available at the table, I'm not one to complain.  Filled with plenty of mushrooms, my favorite.  My SO loved his STRAWBERRY HOTCAKES, a go-to order for him, but the thin crepe-like pancakes they serve here are a nice touch.  The filling could have used more cream, but this certainly wasn't a dealbreaker.  Coffee and hot tea were super basic but satisfying.  We were out the door for 24 bucks before tip.  A simple, family-friendly ordeal.

7tuVKIogR_X06fgIddOspQ.text: The food is awesome! Best pancake (or shall I say hot cake)!? Crispy and delicious.   But the service was not great. Waitresses were rude and service was very slow.   However the food is worth it. Highly recommend

U9j6nbs6IEgOIqUbLyt0Qw.text: Great food,  a little small. Staff was friendly and attentive. Good for breakfast and small group gatherings

VkhQ7OjbVbYjtDvwej6SkA.text: I came with my boyfriend on a Saturday at around 3pm. As soon as we sat down (self-seating) our waitress asked for our drink orders. NOTE THAT THIS IS A CASH ONLY ESTABLISHMENT. I had to run to the Rite-Aid across the street to use the ATM machine which charges a $3.25 transaction fee. Anyway the food was reeeally good and def unhealthy, but that's okay every now and then. The eggs were a bit oily for my liking but I forgave them because the Strawberry Hotcakes were amazing! They come with sour cream which I was a bit hesitant about, but once I took a bite it definitely worked with the flavors and balanced the sweetness. I added syrup just because, but I actually preferred them without syrup. My boyfriend got the famous potatoes and those were also great. I kept taking fork-fulls off his plate. I paid $25 (including tip) for the both of us which I was not mad about. Would return and recommend.

4yGGAwtzZ6rJ3Bv-hzl-6g.text: The line was out the door so we ordered to go. Still took awhile to get the food but it was worth the wait! Just like I remembered it 20 years ago!

3eb-f9zllBRREX8IsuxPxg.text: Not what they used to be. We got the Strawberry and the Blueberry Hotcakes, and were very disappointed. They tasted heavily of grease and they didn't have much brown sugar at all. I only ate the fruit and left the hot cake behind. The service was also only mediocre. We won't be back...

pE3yeNOIzudToBHJw5oEUQ.text: What a disappointment.  Pittsburgh, explain your obsession with Pamela's to me now.  It makes no sense.  Pamela's is decent, though slightly pricey, for just diner food.  You know how you can tell a place isn't worth your time?  When you and your friend are eating at Pamela's and can only discuss how good Murray Ave Grille's breakfast is.  Finally, you both admit you would rather be at the Grille.  Lets start with the big issue:  The service SUCKS.  Apparently, the servers split their tips at the end of the shift.  So no one bothers to serve you.  One guy took our orders and brought drinks, and another girl dropped the food on the table.  No one asked if we needed anything, and no one bothered to check that the food was OK.  So...servers working a buffet do more work than the servers at Pamela's.  I got the ham and cheese omelette, with the potatoes, and rye toast.  The actual breakfast was good diner breakfast.  There was a nice amount of cheese, this potato hater thought the potatoes were good, and the rye toast was fantastic.  There is outdoor and indoor seating, which is nice.  The place is rather packed, though.  Cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ham and cheese omelette, potatoes, rye toast... $7.75

kSmK0MaaB0gjge6HM49ZrQ.text: Mom & pop's place with large portions and great (inexpensive) prices. You can taste the freshness in the food: no boxed or prepackaged main ingredients from what we could taste and the food was deliciously seasoned. So so good. Like... I know my reheated left overs are gonna taste good!   On another note: Bathroom was clean, and we had the pleasure to see the staff thoroughly clean the tables and containers. Service was quick and genuinely friendly.   CASH ONLY!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lyonise potatoes and spinach omelette.

Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French toast Croissant, lyonnaise potatoes, eggs w/ fresh tomatoes, &amp; strawberry &amp; cream cheese &amp; cinnamon stuffed crepe-cakes.

ElBdchejLaBpK_V1YfBOPw.text: Dee-licious! Friend and I enjoyed the breakfast of Champions with eggs, hash browns, and a pancake to share. Everything was delicious! Very friendly service also on a weekday morning. The place is definitely highlighting the visit by President Obama.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pittsburgh Hash

2tDeTFz0rKPMMarjcNsSnw.text: Loveee this place so much! Pancakes are nice and thin with the crispy edges and very buttery:)

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Wa0TWSl7KRo3O-KkynGcdQ.text: TURKEY SAUSAGE!!!!  Yes, I was very happy with the delicious Turkey sausage!  As most reviewers stated, the pancakes (hotcakes) were delicious!  We tried the banana chocolate chip and the plain.  We also ordered the croissant French toast, and they were barely edible...kind of burnt (hence, the reason we're giving this review 4 stars).  Still, I look forward to returning for the hotcakes, breakfast potatoes, and of course, the Turkey sausage.

_0W9GtOuBuYLwJjrlnDZgA.text: We came here for brunch on a weekend, anticipating a wait but the entire staff is so efficient at getting people in and out of the door that we didn't have to wait very long. That being said, your meal does feel very fast because of the efficiency, this isn't going to be your hours long lounge-around brunch. We were told to try this by local friends and so I was excited (I'm definitely a breakfast food person). Being gluten free, I was unfortunately only able to have a few things on the menu (your usual gluten-free breakfast items were all available to me...eggs, potatoes, meat). I wish they would have had a bread substitute which would have opened up quite a few more options. I ended up ordering the meat and cheese omelet which was good. My boyfriend had their famous crepe-style pancakes which he was actually a tad disappointed in (he has grown up with good home-made ones). My one big takeaway would be that it was good but not amazing. I would really appreciate an updated menu with gluten free items clearly delineated.

NOqaTAXOpbOcCFNhMGMZRA.text: Yes, this place lives up to its hype.  Yes, the portions are generous,  the food is fantastic and it arrives quickly and is hot when it gets to your table.    THIS IS A CASH ESTABLISHMENT the closest ATM is a short walk up the street.  Kind of a PITA but whatchagonnado?

gm6nEAyOa1vz4AiB6MKGkw.text: There are diners and then there's Pamela's.  There are no diners like it.  If you only want to eat once day - this is it.  You won't be hungry for 24 hours.  Everything you order is so freakin' good.  Fuck the diet.  Fuck your exercise.  This is carbs overload.  Just order those omelettes and split, yes, split them with your friends.  Portions are humongous.  Forget about cappuccino, they'll bring you hot chocolate and it will mmmm-good. And yes, the lines are EPIC on weekends.  Seriously, this place hits me every time I visit Pittsburgh.

gOCDYf13B3jPVf1_hX8jeQ.text: I have been to this location many times and always thoroughly enjoyed my omelet...today. ..not so much. I ordered the bacon and cheese omelet. The bacon was cold and mushy and the cheese wasn't melted.  The potatoes were a pile of mush obviously left over from the day before. I also had to seek out a server on a coffee refill. Pamela's.....get your act together if you want Joe Biden to come visit. I won't be back for some time.

XaB2tgxAuNYjY0KPXDojHg.text: The best!!! Really! Every time I'm in Pittsburgh, I try to go as many times as I can. Try their famous hot cakes, they rock!  Btw, it's cash only.

yWyrDziQ-mS8nO7WtZqMXA.text: Really good place to grab breakfast. Parking is awful and the lines/wait times can sometimes be insane.   Would recommend visiting to others

HudOe0SNgieyoQ7Tzt1Ynw.text: Wife and I were in Pittsburgh looking for a house. We stopped at Pamela's for breakfast as it had so many really good reviews on Yelp. I had 2 eggs over easy with bacon home fries and toast and a hot chocolate. The eggs were cooked just right but that was were it ended for me. The bacon was not that good and the home fries were not good and had a weird taste to them. The hot chocolate was ok but tasted like swiss miss. The service was excellent and was fast and friendly. I have to say i ws disappointed after seeing so many 5 star reviews and the food being a 2-3 star. Service was excellent and definitely worth 5 stars. I would have to say I would not go back again at least not for eggs and bacon. Too me it looked as though most people were eating pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-8wi_YSl2_ofeUR2QHgvuA.text: Went here for breakfast as I was recommended by a lot of people of this local breakfast spot. I had high expectations and this place didn't do any justice. Overly full for average food.

SZ8EFyZXnpucsw6UefOAnw.text: Not good- damn good!  I had the corned beef hash and if that wasn't enough (really it was), I topped it off with the crepe-style hotcakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corned beef hash and a short stack (after)
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corned beef hash and a short stack (before).

ze2KEn0Y-2UNIg9juJlH2Q.text: I have eaten at all of Pamela's locations and their food never disappoints! This is my go to spot when I have guest visiting the area. Pancakes are a personal favorite. Cheap, friendly staff, and a Pittsburgh staple! 10/10 recommend.

PreQjM_c4oxEjgfc6uKkbQ.text: First of all, I cannot believe that I was in the same restaurant as these people who are leaving four and five star reviews. Maybe you are there on the weekend...or a parallel universe. I was there today, Monday, December 10th at around 11:30.  Came in and saw that not even half of the tables were occupied yet.  Sat down and waited about 10 minutes for someone to approach our table.  There was some girl visiting and obviously a friend of the staff's because that's where the entire staff was!  This went on for another five minutes.  Then a young man came over and what we would like to drink.  Now at this point I am getting curious so I checked my watch...it was exactly 11:47.  At 11:58, I told my lunch partner, "that's it...we're leaving." As my friend started to put on his coat, the young man literally came running and apologizing for the delay.  He said, "I was involved in something else."  He brought our coffee and took our orders.  I had to correct him twice on the order as I watched him write it. The food came, and both orders were wrong.  The young woman who dropped of the meals asked if there was anything else and we told her what was missing and she promptly brought it as well as a pot of coffee which is a Pamela's standard and not done by the young man. What happened? Do P&G not monitor or visit this location any more? Millvale had similar issues but have improved vastly and is a much better location for service. All of the sudden we realized that it was THIS location where we had terrible service before and at the time swore never to return. This time I should etch it into my skin because I will never return. The Strip and Millvale locations will see my money but never again, Squirrel Hill.

OIv2fmDeAx5XOlrWOVxbhg.text: I finally gave into the constant pressure after moving to Pittsburgh to check out Pamela's. I can't say I was disappointed in the slightest. The chocolate chip banana crepes are some of the best crepes I've had and they are very large, which makes for a great breakfast. The Pittsburgh hash, even the side order, is also very delicious and very large in size. The staff are without exception always prompt and friendly. The general atmosphere is ok, I am from a place with a lot of diners so I guess I'm more used to the look, but it's still neat.

p8MTwryjCg0Urqblxf-k4Q.text: Some people say a long wait time, but we happened to go on a randomly dead Sunday morning. The food was excellent and the service was super fast and nice. The hotcakes and the potatoes are really to die for. I recommend the meat and eggs if you're ready to eat a lot. My boyfriend and I shared that and a side of hotcakes and we were both smiling and stuffed. Would absolutely recommend and come back next time we're in Pittsburgh

0KWkZy4OQkO8B6AnGyY3iQ.text: This is the first time I have gone to a Pamela's Diner. The food was very good. I read a review on here that said the food is cooked in too much butter. I can say that is somewhat accurate. All of my food tasted of butter in some way, but it wasn't overwhelming for me. I liked the taste. It just wasn't a light breakfast.   I had the veggie omelet with the potatoes and toast. Everything was delicious, and I couldn't finish my plate because there was so much food.   We arrived at 8:00 on a Saturday, and we could seat ourselves right away. We had great service the whole time. Very friendly and gave us the right amount of attention. I would go back so I can try something else like the croissant French toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie omelet with potatoes and toast
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Morning after special with ham
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Side of pancakes. Yum!!

fbmBhhcwvjsyrk_lRBZ6Rg.text: The breakfast food was good but service was poor.  Messed up order.  Had 3 people at table - one time per person.

fynBQSHbndSsDPBQX0eu2Q.text: Wow. This place is everything everyone always said it was. Honestly, I was skeptical, and I thought it was all hype, but I'm a concert! I ordered the strawberry hotcakes, and they were mind blowing! Instead. Of regular pancakes, they tasted more like high quality crepes! For the price you pay, I'm impressed they were as good as they were! They were nice and crunchy on the outside, and soft and fluffy in the center. The whipped cream was fluffy and melted nicely onto the hotcakes, and the strawberries were as fresh as they get! They didn't use those weird preserves or anything like that. The portions are huge too! When ordering you get 2 hotcakes per order, and 1 was already enough to fill me to the brim. As for service, They kept our cups filled and service was great! I thought it was a bit funny that they had so many pictures of Obama everywhere, haha. Oh! Remember, this place is CASH ONLY!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5WcFwiGKcLDVecUtZfsCdQ.text: Horrible coffee!  So bad the Shadyside Pamela's used to allow customers to bring their own from the coffee across the street. Has been wretched forever so I have lost hope.  The food is great, especially pancakes. But if u want real maple syrup you'll have to bring your own.

OFQvTtK8YvlFrvBQ2cW_hw.text: I came from New York and my husband told me this place has great food. We were seated for 15 min without anyone serving us. I asked on waitress if we could order, and she replied with anger "no! Because I'm busy with other people!" She came back later and told us there were more tables in front of us and if we didn't want to wait it's whatever. Thanks god that I knew people in Pittsburgh are mostly very nice otherwise it will make very bad impression to people who travel here. Also, i seriously doubt if she is racist because we are Asian.

PBx6aC1ZPASKaK3ByEHorA.text: Pamela's has a cult following in the 'Burgh and for good reason--the food is delicious. Their breakfast foods are delightful takes on classics and some new dishes unique to Pamela's. The strawberry hot cakes are everything described in other reviews. My son devours their waffles. Clean plates all around.   The only complaint you can really level at Pamela's is that their popularity means long waits on weekends. We frequent NU, which is nestled inside Pamela's in Squirrel Hill, and it's not uncommon for us to be getting our NU entrees before people waiting at Pamela's got a table.

7LUI3QwLAHxDA8CNj9RNZg.text: Good food for sure, service could be better. I've been here twice in the past month, and the food was good both times, but had an issue with the service both times. It's seat yourself and wait until a waitress comes over. They're usually pretty busy, so you may have to wait at a dirty, wobbly table for awhile. The 2nd time I went I changed from one dirty table to another because I don't think the waitress saw me. No worries...but I didn't really appreciate it when she got irritated I was at a 4 person table (I was solo) and suggested I move to a 2 seater by the bathroom....no, sorry lol.  But, the food. Yes. First time I got the Tex omelette with chorizo, topped with sour cream. Wasn't sure how well the sour cream would go with eggs, but it was great. I was impressed with the flavor of the chorizo too. Nice big slices of bread & those potatoes are the bomb.  2nd time I got the chorizo hash with bacon & a side of kielbasa. The kielbasa was black when it came out but still tasted really good so I didn't complain or send it back.  Sad to say I haven't tried the crepes yet; they sound great!  It gets very busy, is cash only, and you may need patience on even a slow day. But the food is really good and it's a tourist spot you should see if you're visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tex mex omelette

6zGdLA_wsQ0yn4klB5Y1qg.text: The host need to work on their greetings/customer service skills.  If the place is line out the door busy, why not use your time helping servers clear off tables rather than drawing a freaking childlike picture in your notepad?!  The ketchup and syrup bottles at the table were both nearly empty and service could have been better.  Thankfully the delicious food made up for the lacking smiles and declining service.

NYC8lZr0pJN_SzOKM6Vpvw.text: Tried this place for the first time yesterday and we were not disappointed! Friendly staff, quirky decor, and delicious food (good-sized portions), all at a reasonable price! The only thing to remember is that it's cash only.We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tex-mex omelet and meat and eggs

ehnz0H8dwsJcMRnOq5b5ZQ.text: Finally made it here and it didn't disappoint. Got the chorizo hash and strawberry pancake and both were excellent. The hash was truly exceptional, just the right spiciness and cheese made this the best dish I've had in a while. The strawberry pancake was incredible too; light and stuffed with fruit, didn't need any syrup. Would definitely return again

lrA1nUh3-cah7J4RcKuKLw.text: I don't venture into neighborhoods usually when by myself, but so glad I did this time.  All I can say is it is a good thing I am hiking today to work off some of this fabulous food.  Had the strawberry pancakes without whipped cream and the Pittsburgh Hash.  I should have just ordered the Hash.  Truly stupendous!   The pancakes were good, but the Hash is It!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pancakes and Pittsburgh Hash
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strangers

T8qhECzFwrSibV5RwnQCuw.text: Delicious breakfast, fast service, cheap prices, no complaints! Endless coffee was also much needed. Not gourmet food, but delicious diner food and worth every penny. Good sized portions as well, definitely didn't leave hungry.

RQE_jbEePNdArSCIBw7wFQ.text: Pamela's Diner is an iconic Pittsburgh establishment and simply a delicious place to eat. With its various locations around the city, you simply cannot go wrong with this place. I came for the first time last weekend and was blown away by their delicious crepe style "hotcakes". The pancakes were so incredibly crispy on the outside but soft in the center, dripping with melted butter and syrup. I can't wait to return and try out some of the many other GREAT options on this menu. The service was great(very fast and nice), and the atmosphere is super cool and historical. I recommend checking out the original Squirrel Hill location as this diner is packed with Pittsburgh culture and history. MUST GO! Bravo Pamelas and see you very soon!

RXwlPtlAmv3SBwu8Q6wKVA.text: The food was great the service was okay I love the order location in shadyside better .. it's time to do something about the tables the are in bad shape .. Overall the food is good for a great price

FbbTYIOUUhNiP6qqkqztqA.text: A pretty good place overall, the 5 stars seem a bit over rated, but I suppose if you really like what they offer ,then it makes sense. If I could give a 3.5, that might better represent what i think of them.  They are very popular on the weekends. Some of the staff was a lot more on the ball and attentive than others.  I got the Tex-Mex omelet,  and overall it was pretty good. But there were little things that I wasn't thrilled with. They were a bit skimpy on the guacamole,  the chorizo was sparse and diced into tiny bits such that it had some flavor. But it was skimpy as well. Last, they seem to use margarine instead of butter on everything,  although I suppose you could request butter. Just an FYI.  The lyonaise potatoes seems to be their trademark breakfast thing. They are heavy, but good. Seems to be what everyone was getting.  Their crepe style pancakes looked good, if you are into that, but I'm not. They seem like a great choice for a lot of people, just not me.

Rqwj9X-NDSts5wRAXdlhzg.text: Highly recommend this place for a fun breakfast or brunch. Not the healthiest, but absolutely delicious. Unique space tops off the visit. So fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ny6VbxCmJRWOZk1skruCEg.text: Great service and even better food!   Pamela's has been a staple throughout my college career in Pittsburgh and this location in particular is my favorite. I typically order the Morning After special, which comes with hot cakes, eggs, and meat, but I typically substitute the meat for Pamela's famous eggs. As a vegetarian, I'm very grateful that they always allow for this substitution without any hassle. Food usually arrives very quickly after your order is placed. I'm always stuffed after a visit to Pamela's - be prepared to enter a food coma after any meal here!  Other things to note: cash only, be prepared to wait 30+ mins on Saturday and Sunday mornings.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot cake, scrambled eggs, potatoes

LrysmDfzgJfqEISC51g9UQ.text: Come hungry because you're going to leave stuffed!! Wait time on a Saturday morning was around 20 minutes for a party of 2, so it wasn't too bad. There are other small shops in the area to browse if you're waiting for your name to be called.  We ordered corned beef hash, hotcakes, Lyonnaise potatoes, eggs, and a sausage patty. Definitely overestimated how much we could eat since we had a ton of leftovers afterwards and we skipped lunch. The corned beef hash and hotcakes were definitely the highlight of the meal!!   Great diner with some delicious food! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs, Corned Beef Hash, Lyonnaise Potatoes, Hotcakes, Sausage Patties

cNzKAWIUYryceMqPen38Sw.text: Cash only Pittsburgh icon lives up to billing for me every time.  I don't deviate much.  Any of the legendary hot cakes are a no brainer (I like the strawberry the best) and the homemade corned beef hash is simply the best.  The hash is made with their terrific lyonnaise potatoes (although I'm not really sure Lyon agrees that this is a classically French preparation).  They are home fries.  They are great and you can get them with your burger or whatever also.

lHu2pIH-GN-5N21S56pQrQ.text: I've eaten at Pamela's several times over the course of my life and I think I just made excuses for it the entire time. Because it had lines down the block and was basically the only breakfast spot in squirrel hill, I felt like I had to deal with the awful stomach aches I'd get after. The truth is, there is simply TOO MUCH butter on this food. If you see the pancakes in my picture, you will see the edges are brown and fried and completely greasy. This will give a lot of people a stomach ache folks! Can Pamela's be tasty? Sure, because butter can of course be a tasty thing. But I cannot keep pretending this is good breakfast when it's not.  This time around I had a egg sandwich as well, and it was small but decent tasting. I cut off the pancake "crusts" and ate the inside. Maybe the omelettes are safer and less buttery, but I don't really like omelettes, so I can't comment. The potatoes are very delicious but rich and will add to your existing stomach ache.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Egg and cheese sandwich
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Short stack pancakes

IdJBZZ-AGZJz5rRzhCzicw.text: There are few things I missed more than Pamela's Lyonnaise potatoes. After being an undergrad at Carnegie Mellon, I realized how lucky I was to be able to take advantage of the amazing hot cakes, lyonnaise potatoes and the reasonable prices of Pittsburgh. Came back for the first time in 3 years and absolutely made sure that Pamela's was on the itinerary.
