I was worried that I had hyped up the hot cakes too much prior to our arrival but my boyfriend was amazed and how crispy yet soft they were. From family friendly to college hangover friendly, Pamela's is your weekend brunch ritual that every other city in America is missing out on. Hands down has to be one of my favorite brunch places I've been to in the nation.

0KTk1PCrde2qPj9OeU4vwQ.text: A really interesting place if you are from out of town. Very cool old school local vibe happening there.   For my visit the service seems like the High Point of this restaurant. The staff is great!!!   Food is good solid diner food, they have a pancake that Michelle Obama found really great and imported into the White House,   I'm not sure the pancake is done with as much love as the original chef...   Set aside a less than exciting pancake, the eggs, home fries and toast were amazing, but again, best of all the service is incredible the girls who work there are super nice very friendly and make you feel like you must come back.  Sure I'll be back, next time it's flippies & slippies, for me, Ha ha you have to visit to find out what that is about.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YX_jrkYNSy6bO229ZJXnLw.text: Get the hot cakes and the hash.   They are the perfect combo for a guilty brunch. The hot cakes have crispy sides but a soft and buttery inside. If you want them stuffed, the strawberry was my favorite - the acidity cuts the oily fatty feeling (vs. the banana walnut one). The hash was a wonderful savory complement - it was a combo of cheese, meat and potatoes in harmony.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Stuffed hot cakes with hash as a side

rUWqY5kZD19Q8-epQQQWQw.text: Food: usually good, but pretty sub-par this morning.  Atmosphere: diner.   Service: TERRIBLE! We were forgotten apparently. We waited 15 mins for drinks, then 15 until WE FLAGGED SOMEONE DOWN who was not our waitress, to place the order. The food was fine, but we obviously got dropped and it wasn't even busy!!!  I would have complained in person but I was with company and that's inappropriate. We both remarked about how strange the service was. So disappointed!

xwvMm8fXDWoyGMDvvHr8WA.text: Good place for brunch and value for money. Their potatoes are very delicious, with lots of flavor. Food portions are HUGE.  I like their omelets with veggies. The fruit cup was a bit too sweet as they added syrup. Their strawberry pancakes are good. A great balance of sweetness and buttery.  Services is good for diners. Make sure to arrive early to avoid long wait duringvl weekends.

9d3IMqXtUeMolbvqLcCCHQ.text: I don't often give out five stars, but when I do, it's for Pamela's crape pancakes. Cash only is annoying.

6bZcePxjuTByAomTetW5Tg.text: I had maneuvered the hungry crowds waiting on Murray for admission into Pamela's over multiple weekends and decided it was finally time, as a resident of Pittsburgh, to be one of the masses waiting street side.  Fortunately I went with just one other breakfast lover and our wait was less than the quoted 10-15 minutes.  We were ushered in after about a 5 minute wait.  The service here is fast and efficient.  After binging on leftover Halloween candy, I opted out of the famed California french toast or crepe items and instead got the more savory corned beef and Swiss omelet.  It was really delicious, and I agree that the potatoes are excellent. With quick service, good coffee, and wonderful breakfast fare, I imagine that I will be a regular sidewalk obstacle for Murray weekend pedestrians.

JbJjQfoM4vcMRwh7KVBtdw.text: After moving to Pittsburgh almost a year ago, I decided it was finally time to check out a Pittsburgh institution and go to brunch at Pamela's. At the server's recommendation, I got the strawberry hotcakes (with fresh strawberries) and Lyonnaise potatoes. Yum. I was a little confused about why they call these "hotcakes" when they seemed more crepe-y to me - but very tasty nonetheless. The potatoes were crispy and superb. This is not a breakfast to have daily (or even weekly, probably) if you're watching your sodium or fat intake but it was certainly a great diner meal. At $7.50 for the strawberry hotcakes and $3.00 for the potatoes, I thought it was just a tad pricey for a place that doesn't have real maple syrup. That being said, the next time my dad visits, I'm bringing him there. I know he'll love it.

AgzgDlgLYgdbQYMP6qdsCw.text: I do like this Pamela's better than the one in Oakland. While I think the one in Oakland is fun to go with friends, this one is quieter and nicer for a breakfast with hubby.

1MZOSz6xUFmb7mRBa8VhXw.text: What a fantastic breakfast. Service is good and the food is outstanding. Parking can be tricky but with a fun neighborhood like this, who cares? I'll go back here again ASAP!

sCTUHw8eCJU0zHW0ZiCXHQ.text: Surprisingly, I am not a big Pamela's fan.  It is OK,  not too expensive and a pretty big menu except that they do not have waffles!  How can they not have waffles?  I will get them a waffle machine!  I am not a big fan of their pancakes as I think they are too greasy and I prefer the light fluffy kind....Eggs and toast items are OK.... Good place to take kids.

OS7DHnj70IjPoXjrE-93cQ.text: Wow!  The banana and chocolate chip pancakes are incredible.  Great little diner.  Will definitely be back next time I'm in Pittsburgh.

ziotJ8nTJuNCtNZ_T5L0Wg.text: Good Breakfast spot. However not outstanding. Try strawberry hotcakes.

WPIG-6MjpoK3b8yCv0XBeQ.text: What do strawberries, brown sugar and sour cream have in common...? (see the answer below.) Don't let the long line, that winds out of the restaurant, discourage you. These folks are serious foodies and will not let you languish, light-headed from hunger, out on the street. I walked in the door thinking that it would be a month long weight. The perky hostess, with the really cool wind-surfing shoes chirped, "15 minutes." And 15 minutes it was down to the last second.  Pamelas is one of those small, cozy (and by "cozy" I mean a tight fit) neighborhood places that you wish were just around the corner from where you live.  I went with the suggestions by my fellow Yelpers and ordered the strawberry hotcakes. The hotcakes are really not the kind you'd get in most diners - these are thin, chewy, delicately browned, buttery crepes filled with....drum roll, please...fresh strawberries, brown sugar and sour cream.  Somehow all these ingredients work together in one melodious symphony in your mouth. It is just the right combination of sweet and tart. My only complaint is portion sizes. They give you two of these delights that cover the plate from end-to-end. Service was lightening fast (5 minutes on a busy Saturday morning) and pleasant. Coffee was strong but rich - the kind you love to doctor to get it just right. The hub order corned beef hash - delish - this stuff ain't outta the can!  If I lived in Pittsburgh, this would be my go-to breaky stop!!

L6Ikr8ZqPazzq_acCi5FUg.text: Banana chocolate chip hotcakes.  That's all you need to know.

ej_0EAM6zx7EgQuXVotzRg.text: Grease + Huge Portions + Low Prices = Solid Breakfast

7RQJDrZQIYIkIU_jwBJDng.text: I've been going to Pamela's in it's various locations for over 20 years, mainly for the pancakes, which are indeed wonderful.  However, in my visit today, I desired a second cup of hot tea. The server attempted to charge me again, a second $1.90. When I objected, I was told it was the policy.  I spoke with the manager. He would not change the policy, and said only that he would talk to the general manager. I asked if the restaurant charged for a second cup of coffee. Of course not. Refills on iced tea? Free, of course. I pointed out the cost to the restaurant of that second cup of tea. (Approximately seven cents, including the generic tea bag, a few ounces of hot water.) He only reiterated that he couldn't change the policy.  It's a shame, I've enjoyed Pamela's. But until they change this obnoxious policy, I won't be returning.

8Xi7GYNOaXyL1QDfIVX4aw.text: Excellent quality and quantity and great bang for your (cash only) buck!  I order Gail's Eggs every single time I come here but have sampled husband's pancakes, omelettes and hashes- all incredible.  The staff is warm and welcoming and there seems to be very little turnover as I continually see the same faces, year after year.  My only complaint is the cash-only aspect, but since they're so good they can get away with it.

rTEEd2z_HkKm4BR2Zpm4tQ.text: Delicious!  My husband and I ate here for brunch on a Saturday morning.  We were able to walk right in around 9am and were served immediately.  We shared the chorizo hash with fried eggs, strawberry hotcakes, and a side of lyonnaise potatoes.  Everything was absolutely delicious.  The strawberry hotcakes are stuffed with fresh strawberries and sour cream which was a surprisingly amazing combination.  I would go back everyday just for the lyonnaise potatoes.  Do not forget to order these when you go!  Quaint, diner environment with an open front-room if the weather is nice.  The perfect brunch place whenever you visit Pittsburgh!

jXidwDNgazAXdgour3Y2Ag.text: I was visiting friends. In Pittsburgh and they said I had to try this place.  It was quite good and the pancakes were bigger than my head.  But being that I'm a Jersey native, I'm a bit biased on diners.  It's certainly good.  And most certainly worth giving your business to.  But if you want diner food, get on 80 and head east.

0t9lm-U01j6oGynaN6YS_w.text: Went with a large group on a Saturday morning. Was seated and served quickly. Everyone thought the food was delicious. Especially liked the blueberry pancakes and Gail's eggs. We'll be back!

3lwVJPALSHS5MhaJ6wPRHQ.text: Excellent I had an omelette mixed omelette was outstanding probably one of the best I've ever had doesn't sound like much but it was. everybody else's food looked excellent and the place is really cute I give it 5 stars

VpapKnGxrukvyCXjmn-neQ.text: I absolutely LOVE Pamela's. It's my favorite breakfast/brunch place in Pittsburgh.  Eggs, bread and egg have never tasted better than at Pamela's. I wish they weren't cash only, but that's a really minor issue. The wait can be quite a bit since it's crowded almost all the time (unless you go late, say around 2pm), but it's definitely worth it. The Hot Chocolate is amazing! I just graduated from CMU and left Pittsburgh, and I miss eating at Pamela's already!

40OXPIwegAPVFM7mv12C5w.text: Not impressed. Came here after reading the reviews and hearing that it is a Pittsburgh staple. The service was nothing memorable but wasn't bad. The  atmosphere is a over crowded typical diner. I do give them props for there eggs and bacon light fixture. Sadly I don't go to restaurants for decor. The food was  bad. I got a omelette with toast, my friend got their pancakes. The omelette was blend and among the worst diner omelettes I have tried. There was no freshness to the eggs nor meats. My toast was swimming in butter, I actually scraped two layers off. The pancakes that they are famous for....tasted like thinly fried butter. More like state fair food than a restaurant. I will be sticking to traditional pancakes. There are way to many diners around here to give them a second chance.

U7o0zdQYhH7E9hd8zgzRkw.text: I've been coming every Wednesday afternoon for about a month now and only have about 30 minutes to eat and the girls here are always so good about coming to the table as soon as I sit down and bringing the food fast without me even asking. Makes my life a lot easier and obviously the food is amazing. Wonderful service.

HwHKSsR3N6H1vXr62Dissg.text: Today I was in a Pamela's Pancake Coma. After ingesting two of these famous little devils, I proceeded to race to the airport (Because we left the restaurant too late) and missed my flight back to Boston. I am writing this waiting for 5 hours, and I still am not hungry for lunch. At least I ended my trip home well.   This story, only validates the fact that when growing up in Pittsburgh,  Pamela's is the best staple breakfast joint. The previous location in Squirrel Hill was a tiny little hut, but now, the new Pamela's Upstreet takes over the old Panera space on Murray Avenue and includes garage door-style front patio.  My staple at Pamela's has to be the crispy crepe-like chocolate chip, banana stuffed pancakes! They are thin and decadent. Buttery and rich. After eating two of these, you will be stuffed, happy and ready for a mid-morning nap (or a missed flight) I also love that they also have a special called "The Morning After," Which, I feel like describes the quality of Pamela's "Hangover Cure." Also, don't forget to try the semi-famous potatoes alongside a carafe of hot coffee for 1.95 pp!   My only riff is that I find it problematic that our server was busy and couldn't be that attentive. I'm sure the weekends are a circus show, but I still give them 5 stars. It's a diner people!   Maybe next time I'll eat at Pamela's before the day of my flight. So I can stuff my face, and go home to take a nap.

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana stuffed choc chip pancakes!

vWfOTaG4yMs4egCJdj1CFg.text: Not a bad place for brunch once in a while, especially if you're looking for some comfort/hangover food. They have pretty standard brunch selections--hotcakes, French toast, omelettes, eggs, bacon and sausage combinations, etc. They also offer burgers and salads. Nothing to rave about though. Hotcakes are apparently their specialty, but get them plain and they will get too buttery and sickening after a few bites.   Which is why most people go for their various hotcakes with toppings; an especially recommended one is the banana walnut. The strawberry cream is also quite good. But do keep in mind that the main thing that turned the hotcake into such a sweet concoction is a couple days' worth of sugar and syrup. At the very least, their breakfast combinations are huge (so as to keep in proportion with the sugar maybe).  Their service is also mediocre; they try to have it like a diner atmosphere, but in reality what happens is that your server (or any server at all) rarely comes by once you order and the food comes. It was a challenge to ask for a refill of water. At the end you bring your receipt up and pay at the counter (which only accepts cash, beware), and then as common courtesy you have to go BACK to your table and leave your meager tip for their meager service.

wuuawhsXSUGjvnt3HjZsEg.text: I am a man who cares about pancakes. Pamela's makes the best pancakes. Period. The home fries are also excellent. Everything else is fine (eggs, bacon, omelettes, etc.) but not amazing. They don't have pure maple syrup... and usually that's a deal-breaker for me when it comes to pancakes, but the pancakes are so freaking good that you don't even have to put anything on them at all. 6 stars for the pancakes, 4 for everything else, call it 5.

xCzRxLXJ0FPZ_mMLANqXFw.text: Just because they moved to a bigger location (and replaced Panera) doesn't mean that the wait gets that much shorter, especially if you have a group of more than 4 hungry people.  Their hotcakes and corn beef hash are very yummy as usual. The service is fast and feisty like before. Also, CASH ONLY. Even with their attitude and the wait...I haven't been able to get breakfast as good as this so I'm willing to tolerate anything.  My must-get is strawberry hotcakes with a side of corn beef hash. You can't go wrong with that!

p2YiwUXOBaJlpBwlNdp2PA.text: Pamela's is the GO TO breakfast spot in Pittsburgh. Whenever I have friends from out of town come visit, I always take them here, and they ALWAYS rave over how good the food was. Their famous strawberry hotcakes are to die for! The portion size is great, I normally never finish my meal! Super fast service, and friendly staff! As this place is ALWAYS packed, the only con is the wait time! They also DO NOT accept cards, CASH ONLY, that can be a little inconvenient at times

osCQFbPP-s4l2t9j5tfoYQ.text: Delicious!  Savory and sweet breakfast items are great here.  Their ingredients taste fresh, and they make a great veggie omelet.

WTmMRNl85T_Y9xd_xyIhkQ.text: I've had my share of complaints about the chain of Pamela's restaurants--most saliently, very few menu items are good and you shouldn't call yourself a diner if I can't walk in and get breakfast for dinner--but the one in Squirrel Hill really hit a new low the way they kept us waiting.  Yes, I know Pamela's is very popular and one should expect a line.  I would have had no problem with a line.  There was no line.  There were tons of empty tables.  But my brunch companion and I were left standing around.  A simple miscommunication or oversight by the staff?  I thought so too, but after talking with two staff members three times, it was obvious that was not the case.  Eventually I figured out the problem: there were two of us, and they didn't want to waste a table that could seat four people on a mere couple.  This seems like a bad business practice on a number of levels.  First, it annoys your customers to keep them waiting.  It annoys them even more when they're standing next to multiple empty tables and aren't allowed to use any of them.  Second, with no line and many empty slots, it's hardly profit maximizing.  I could have been halfway through my meal by the time another customer walked in, and given the relatively late hour and the way the crowd was dwindling, the restaurant might not have been completely full at any point for the rest of the day.  I always thought waiting in line at Pamela's happened because it was just that popular.  But maybe it's not.  Maybe waits at Pamela's happen because they don't know how to properly manage a queuing system.

XNS4L0BN_aUlJpdk5GHy0Q.text: Love the food and the atmosphere, however some of the wait staff are very rude!!!!! My sister and I were seated, and we were asked for drink orders. Right after we were asked for our food order, and didn't even get a chance to browse the menu. We advised we needed a couple minutes to decide, and then she went to get our drinks. Observing... The same waitress automatically brought water to other tables before taking their drink orders, and throughout the meat she came to check on everyone but US... this particular waitress barely got a tip for this kind of behavior.... They also forgot the cheese for mine and my sisters eggs...

Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Western Omelette... good, but they forgot the cheese...

stNc1eKXVpe3Hzxhub2lzQ.text: I go to Pamela's every other Saturday. I can't say how good it is overall because I always get the same thing and it's delicious. the chirizo hash and eggs is one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. it keeps bringing me back. One day I'm sure I'll get something else but that day is not in the near future.

Vsirkq_XbXH9BUqQBHyuMQ.text: Always very busy but our meal has always been great.   Their hotcakes are fabulous and I also really like Gail's famous eggs (scrambled eggs with cream cheese and green onions).

P0o1I1a8je-374w_Bz6z-Q.text: Pamela's is amazing, I've been going here for years and never fails to disappoint. Strawberry hotcakes and omelette... Home fries are my favorite!! Always leave feeling full and pleased. When my friends from out of town are visiting I always take them here and they always rave about how delicious it was. Pamela's is definitely Pittsburgh's diner!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry hotcakes and morning after special. Over easy eggs, sausage links, and home fries. So delicious!

xS9R8uAGK-PyRgRL521BnQ.text: Delicious, cheap, great service. I prefer the Pamela's on Walnut better (atmosphere is more quaint, and I love the decor), but I'd totally go back!

ALHFycq2Qx3_9E3Mw2MSnQ.text: Pamela's has moved from its old Squirrel Hill location on Forbes next to the library, and is right around the corner on Murray, in the former Panera Bread space.   Even though they have put in a lot of tables in this new location, the dining area feels a lot less cramped than the old space. If you're lucky, you might even be able to snag one of the patio tables overlooking Murray.   The food and service is more or less the same as the old location. Get the strawberry hotcakes. Even though I feel sleepy after polishing them off, those thin crispy pancakes rolled up with strawberries and brown sugar are totally worth it. The servers aren't the friendliest, but they're very efficient and will have your order out in very little time--which means you can be savoring strawberry hotcakes all the sooner.  Oh, and keep an eye out on the storefront next door--Pamela's owners are turning it into a Latin American eatery. I wish I weren't moving from this neighborhood and from Pittsburgh so soon!

s7NPfqK3rHTG4AvHacwesA.text: I love their Lyonnaise potatoes. Best I have ever had. My favorite hotcake is the banana walnut one. What I don't like about their omelette is that the fillings and the egg part are always separated and as you cut through the omelette they fall apart completely. So it feels like you have ordered scrambled eggs and a side of veggies/meat rather than an omelette. Although this might be a style, I am just not a fan of this type of omelette.

yL0vS1ly65JutrECF_Q2WA.text: We love. There is a reason that Pamela's is a Pittsburgh institution  Items we love. 1. California French Toast 2. Short Stack -- their crepe-like pancakes help make them famous; you must try some!!! 3. Lyonnaise Potatoes 4. "Morning After" Breakfast Special 5. Buffalo Chicken Wrap (lunch N/A on Sundays) 6. Waffles  Other things we love. 1. Cassy, Adam, and the whole staff in Squirrel Hill -- super friendly staff! 2. The front room and the outdoor area 3. The food comes out FAST, even when they're busy  Things we could do without. 1. CASH ONLY 2. Long waits -- expect one weekends from 9:30-12ish 3. There's butter everywhere -- you can them to hold it from pancakes, waffles...

3uGC7RloeO1b3Gu3jEjo7w.text: Creative egg options; Crepe-style pancakes; great diner coffee; friendly and efficient staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

DlmfzNYmSLCMnGnzSKYAAQ.text: Pamela's may not be the worst breakfast place I've ever been to but it is certainly  the most overrated. Ordered a mushroom omelette with the lyonnaise potatoes. The omelette was extremely under-cooked and the mushrooms were bland, soggy and metallic tasting as if the cook had just scooped a spoonful out of a can and plopped ithem into the eggs. The potatoes were also soggy and tasteless. Other members of our party had the pancakes which were slightly better but far from worthwhile. Figuring that it might have been an off day we tried Pamela's a second time when we returned to Pittsburgh a few months later. Exact same result.  I just don't get why this place has any sort of good reputation. I've had some good breakfasts in Pittsburgh. Just never at Pamela's.

YFAfTrDOZOP4Bea1YN2l_Q.text: The food and service were outstanding! I absolutely love the banana and chocolate chip pancakes!!! Yummy!

puyiR4tDv5gEiqMaQifk9A.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in the entire city!  If you go on a Saturday or Sunday morning you better be ready to wait in line!  The place fills out really fast.  People don't really stay here for too long so it's not too bad of a wait.  Food is delicious and the service is always on point.

mDtTUJWuNbHKjcZIT56aYA.text: Love to explore and compare diners in and around Pittsburgh.  Pamela's in Squirrel Hill gets a "10" from me.  The egg whites veggie omelette was a home run, the Lyonnaise potatoes are killer, and even the black coffee was perfect.  I always enjoy some hot sauce on my breakfast food, but I couldn't bring myself to potentially mask the flavors, which were outstanding.    Liz was the attentive server, while I understood that Luis was the cook.  A tip of the cap to the team at Pamela's. It couldn't have been a better!

yG3PLts6L9r7vH4aqajWuQ.text: Pamela's is a unique breakfast place. First it should be noted that you can expect wait time to vary from no time at all to 30-40 minutes if they are really busy. And they often are very busy especially between 8-11 on the weekend. Also, the Squirrel Hill location and I believe most of the others are cash only. To get the full Pamela's experience I suggest you order the pancakes (the strawberry stuffed are my personal favorite) and an order of lyonnaise potatoes. The pancakes are almost as thin as a crepe, so if you're looking for a traditional thick buttermilk flapjack you won't find it here. The service is usually very quick and pretty friendly even at the busiest times. Overall this is a great breakfast spot if you won't something unique to Pittsburgh.

FzWTMlQcLvUcDV8tHM80lw.text: Pamela's is a Pittsburgh staple. I feel like you have to go to Pamela's if you live here, or if you're visiting, or if you're just driving through. The hotcakes are famous, and are something between a crepe and a traditional pancake with a little magic thrown in. The banana chocolate chip hotcakes are definitely the best ones and I order them every time, but I've also seen people order: the croissant french toast, different hotcakes, hash, and omelets and no one has ever been disappointed. The potatoes are also awesome. Probably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had.  The main problem with Pamela's is that everyone and their mom visits on the weekend, so plan on standing around a bit to wait for a table. They also only accept cash.

pNDCJVZzP3hgV13ssi1_Qw.text: Good for brunch. Dishes are pretty heavy on carbs,  fat and cheese. But they are delicious. once in few months it's ok to have that kind of food. Service is pretty quick on weekday mornings. Cash only.

CCAm73rKT3r96iDG57H0hg.text: Went for break fast  had french toast and omlette. Food is good and nice.Nice and wonderful coffee. The issue is you have to wait for long time to get in. It's famous though .

6dBiBWxBSNwHXfVJaOs-vA.text: This is a place we always take out of town guests, and I wish more people would visit us, because I can't get enough of the crispy, salty-sweet hotcakes at Pamela's.    My partner is partial to the Corned Beef Hash, which even as a side can be two meals (for some people). My mom likes the crepe pancakes.  For me it's hotcakes all the way, or if I'm feeling indulgent, the specialty hotcakes, with bananas and chocolate chips. The lyonnaise potatoes are also tasty if you need some additional starch.  The coffee generally leaves something to be desired, and it's a bit annoying that they're a cash only joint, but the food comes out fast, and as long as I've got hotcakes in front of me, I'm happy.  Expect a wait if you go on the weekend.

dFkpV8-mNwESOHiOSYKldA.text: This was our first time at this Pamela's location and my first time ordering "lunch" as opposed to breakfast food. All around high marks. My husband devoured his chorizo hash, I opted for a BLT w/ fries. Very satisfied with my sandwhich, the bacon was crispy, lettuce fresh, and the fires crunchy. Service was friendly and very on-the-ball, which I've found at the Oakland location as well so no surprise there. We are looking at houses in Sq. Hill and discussed how great it would to make this Pamela's location part of our weekend routine. We'll see you after closing!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. First time having &#34;lunch&#34; blt &amp; fries.

z1OTX1hrrlpSBBg99EbLRg.text: Pamela's has the best pancakes. period. The Lyonnaise potatoes are amazing as well. I wish I knew how to make these at home kinda good. The eggs are always prepared right and the corn beef and swiss omelete is a must try. Just go. eat. enjoy. It's that simple.

_xRR1IAO8iV7hJupxSvcGQ.text: First, dont let the line/crowd out front deter you! We got there and there was a bunch of people outside but we were seated within 15 mins which isnt bad for a Sunday at all. Second, the food is marvelous. I got the banana walnut hot cakes which were more crepe like than pancake, but were delicious. There was a good banana, walnut, hot cake ratio going so you could really taste all aspects. The coffee was good too. Hot and refillable. I tried my friends layonnaise potatos and they were also good. I wasnt diappointed at all. And its really not expensive but it is CASH ONLY. It has a diner vibe but the servers are pretty hipster. It caters to all types. I would definatley go back, we drove from delmont. Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Pamela's Upstreet Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Walnut banana pancakes, tex mex omlete, and corned beef omlete

IuWpGti2vZgxFUCNGi_1bw.text: Believe the hype. Great food and service. Had a wait on Sunday AM but line moved briskly.   Crispy edged hot cakes were worth the trip. Lyonnaise potatoes were off the charts. Best of all was the Pittsburgh Hash. Unique and loaded with flavor

HT8_GoFUhnn342569KY-Lg.text: Great food and great service! Came in Friday after thanksgiving and it was super packed. There was a wait for most tables, but because we only had 2 we were seated right away. I had the chorizo omelet. It was great! The chorizo wasn't greasy, the eggs were moist and it had the right amount of cheese. The potatoes are the best diner potatoes I've ever had! Coffee was ok, but bottomless and they give you a carafe on the table so you can refill yourself. My partner got fluffy scrambled eggs with cream cheese. He loved them too.   Note this place is cash only. The food is worth the wait if you have to. And it's reasonably priced. I highly recommend!!

F-yP3WuGYMxOocEYMboxKA.text: The food here is worth the wait on a weekend brunch and the service is great. I came here for the first time today with a good friend of mine, she got an omelet I got a crepe. Both dishes were delicious.  That being said, management really should update to accept credit and debit cards.

MGOWHIfmyddFfILdLLCkcw.text: Weekend in Pittsburgh and we had at least three friends tell us we need to go here and we confirmed that after breakfast.  This is a basic diner with great breakfast food.  Our group had the spinach & feta omelet, the pancakes, the Banana chocolate chip pancakes, and the raisin French toast.  Our favorite was the Banana Chocolate Chip pancakes....sliced bananas rolled in a light chocolate chip pancake topped with whipped cream, SO GOOD!  The portions are large, breakfast potatoes are great, crispy on the outside and soft inside.  About $10 per person.  We arrived at 8:30 on a sunday morning and were seated right away.  By the time we were done there was a line for a table, but turnover is fairly quick and worth the wait.

kwjxm7AeD_9Of9gtIbpvAQ.text: They are most known for their strawberry pancakes, that the Obama's love.  But i tried the croissant french toast with caramel pecan.   WOW.   best breakfast ever.   I want to go back SO bad.   :(     There was ALOT that sounded amazing on the menu.   A must.   Yummy.   My hubby on the other hand had an omelette, and the famous potatoes.  He said the omelette tasted like a stick of butter.   :(      I would def go back.  they only accept cash, which also sucked.

eQPp0v2FSIW-AFxEswPxHQ.text: Delicious breakfast! The waffle and the corn beef hash were of the best I've had in the area. Coffee was good and the waitress was attentive. The diner was busy even on a Tuesday morning, but it's easy to see why.

KcYQdsppYhn61mAPEE5iuA.text: The Obama's love their pancakes so you know they're a big deal to the locals. Love their corned beef hash and eggs but my favorite is the banana walnut pancakes with bacon. Delicious doesn't begin to describe it. Cash only and they get busy so go during the week or be patient.
